section.title: Passwords
section.para: The various OpenStack services and the required software like the database and the messaging server have to be password protected. You use these passwords when configuring a service and then again to access the service. You have to choose a password while configuring the service and later remember to use the same password when accessing it. Optionally, you can generate random passwords with the pwgen program. Or, to create passwords one at a time, use the output of this command repeatedly: $ openssl rand -hex 10
This guide uses the convention that SERVICE_PASS is the password to access the service SERVICE and SERVICE_DBPASS is the database password used by the service SERVICE to access the database.

The complete list of passwords you need to define in this guide are:
Passwords
Password name Description
Database password (no variable used) Root password for the database
RABBIT_PASS Password of user guest of RabbitMQ
KEYSTONE_DBPASS Database password of Identity service

GLANCE_PASS Password of Image Service user glance

DASH_DBPASS Database password for the dashboard
